alert.note: Alert for Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 9:31PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Seneca, southwestern Cayuga and northwestern Tompkins Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 931 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Covert, or 14 miles east of Dundee, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Covert, Genoa, Ledyard, Trumansburg, Aurora, Interlaken, Townsendville, King Ferry, Sheldrake and Kidders. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
